When Sory has free time she likes to read, most of all literary works, and in addition she likes to eat one of her favorite dishes which is the flavorful “Aji de Gallina.” Because of few economical resources she only attended high school, but she would have liked to study business administration.

Sory, with hard work and savings, was able to open a business selling clothing. She works about ten hours a day and can attend up to thirty customers per day. She believes that her business is going well because she is very charismatic and kind to her customers and above all she offers products of quality at affordable prices.

Sory is very grateful to Kiva for the loans and thanks to the big help given to her she will be able to buy more merchandise and especially autumn clothes in order to have a better variety of products to offer her customers and thus to improve her income that permits her to continue fighting each day in order to reach her grand dream: to attend business administration classes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (autumn clothes)

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is a 28-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two young children in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province.  He works as a driver for a private company and he receives his payment monthly to support his family, while his wife works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city.  Pha and his wife are determined to make working a priority in order to provide their two children the basic necessities, especially education.  It is the only legacy they can pass on to them.

Due to the lack a vehicle, Pha is experiencing difficulties meeting both his living and transportation needs.  For this reason, Pha would like to obtain a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle, which will enable him to better his situation.  He will travel to his workplace by himself without the necessity of paying for a taxi service.  He is very thankful for the great support from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul es socio del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 29 años de edad, es socio de Finca Perú hace 2 años, es padre de 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de papa por mayor, el aprendió a poder ahorrar, se da cuenta que esta progresando mucho y lo mejor es que aprende a ser buen padre y esposo, las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a tener los conocimientos de cómo hacer que su negocio crezca, ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de papa.
texts.en:
Raul is a member of the Suni Communal Bank. He is 29 years old, and has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years. He is the father of 4 children. 

He works selling potatoes at wholesale prices. He learned to be able to save, he is making good progress and what is best is he has learned to be a good husband and father. The training that he receives from the communal bank helps him to have the knowledge of how to make his business grow, and now this loan is to be used to buy potatoes.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband is employed and the oldest child studies at the secondary school. 

She has been running a taxi and public transportation service since 2006 with her husband. They have a Sonata van and a “Grace” minibus for the business. Uranchimeg became experienced in the field and usually drives between the town and the area with tourist attractions. She has a further plan to improve the household. 

Uranchimeg is a talented driver woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing some necessary spare parts to continue the business normally. I want to increase the income and build a house for the family." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy the spare parts for the van.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts for her van.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 53   años, está casada y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su finca comprando abanos, plaguicidas, y el pago de mano de obra y tambien  cuenta con una parte de pasto en la que tiene unas vacas. El  pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha del café y sembrar una mejor calidad de pasto para sus vacas. El quiere obtener una buena producción del café y con mejores pastos poder obtener mejores resultados con el ganado y poder mantener mas vacas. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 53, is married and lives with his wife and 2 children. He plans to use the loan to help his farm, purchasing fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for labor costs. Part of which grows coffee and the other part is pasture where he has some cows. He will invest in inputs like compost, labor and fungicides so that he can get a better coffee harvest and plant better-quality grass for his cows. He wants to get a good coffee production and use better grass so that he can get better results from his cattle and maintain more cows. He wants to generate more income for the well-being of his family and himself, and to have greater financial stability. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in inputs like compost, labor and fungicides so that he can get a better coffee harvest and plant better-quality grass for his cows.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su hijo y su esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar cosméticos para su posterior venta. Ella tiene pensado comprar mucha variedad de  cosméticos  para tener una mejor rotación, ella quiere  venderla a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad y para hacer competente  y poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica de ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Karen is 20 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her son and her husband.  

Karen wants to use the loan to purchase cosmetics that she can sell.  She plans to buy a wide range of cosmetics so she can increase her turnover.  She wants to sell her products for a good price at the local market, to run her business competently, and to earn higher profits so can achieve a better quality of life and a stable economic situation for herself and her family.  

This is Karen’s first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans with government-run banks, but the loan FUDECOSUR is offering her has better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn describes herself as a responsible, patient and determined person. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Despite her physical condition, she is still able to run her variety store patiently. While she is busy improving her store, her husband also has a great time in running their corn field. They really want to improve their way of living and send their children into a higher level of education.

Jennylyn had been engaged in the retail store business for three years. She is glad because with the long period of time she had spent in her business, she was able to overcome trials in life through the financial support of the KIVA lenders to her. She paid back her previous loan and is asking for more capital amounting to PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy a complete set of merchandise. 

This would make her business continue to grow because she could satisfy her customers’ demand. In this way, she could obtain greater profits to cover all her household expenses and save some amount for the bright future of her children.

loans.use: to buy a complete set of merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is married and has a child. She is 36 years old and lives in Maningcol, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Joanne is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 2,300 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,200 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Joanne joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is 42 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where the land on which he produces white corn and coconut is located.  He was just 32 years old when he started cultivating this land.  Although it has been quite some time, he never ceases because his passion for doing so urges him to go on working.  

At the end of the month, Ronilo earns 12,000 PHP, which he equally divides for his family.  Ronilo joined GDMPC to access the financial services offered by the cooperative.  He has borrowed 17,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizer to increase farm production.  With the income generated from this loan, Ronilo plans to buy a car and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase farm production.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is married and has four children.  She is 53 years old and resides in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  

Miguela plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living and she has been in business for 10 years.  Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 4,400 PHP in order to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.  

In 2011, Miguela joined GDMPC.  In the future, Miguela wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise (sugar, rice, noodles and canned goods, among other items).

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, bebidas refrescantes, pues esto le ayuda a mantener lo necesario en el negocio para poder atender la demanda de los clientes, esperando que sea una buena experiencia este nuevo financiamiento.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues genero mayores ingresos para el sustento familiar, ha mejorado la situación económica de la familia.
texts.en:
Arely is requesting a new loan to buy corn, firewood and beverages.  This will help her to have the supplies she needs for her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers.  She expects to have a good experience with this new loan.

Arely says that she has had a good result with her previous loan; she was able to generate more income to support her family, and this has improved her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and beverages

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not running water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling produce at the market to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of expanding her business to a full grocery stall in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES, Filipina plans to purchase mangoes, bananas and onions.  She decided to join Yehu in order to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, bananas and onions.

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde el año 2000, procedente de Sincelejo capital del departamento de Sucre, con muchos sueños e inició trabajando como operaria y contrajo matrimonio del cual nacieron 2 hijos, hoy en las edades de 6 y 9 años; este hecho le indicó que debía dedicarse mas tiempo a su hogar por eso dejó de ser empleada y empezó a realizar actividades que le permitieran generar ingresos simultáneos a la responsabilidad de su familia. Se inclinó por las artesanías armando piezas con herrajes, con los que fabricaba artesanalmente accesorios en plata, actividad que aprendió en un taller cercano a su vivienda, donde apoyaba a un vecino que trabajaba en platería. Por medios visuales de comunicación conoció de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se interesó en su programa de formación para emprendedores y posteriormente accedió a financiamientos con los que compró su laminador, con el cual fue gradualmente independizándose. Poco a poco pensando en diversificar su oferta, compró 4 vitrinas 1 motor toll, 1 perforadora, un equipo de soldar y agregó también mercancía variada convirtiendo su negocio en una miscelánea tal como hoy funciona;  en sus negocios es apoyada por su hermana, una amiga y su esposo, quienes comercializan las prendas que ella elabora. En su negocio vende a crédito y de contado, sus clientes se acercan a su negocio a comprar artículos de misceláneas, ya que cuenta con un espacio adecuado en la vivienda para la exhibición de sus prendas. En la actualidad Está aplicando a un credikiva, séptimo  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de miscelánea como ropa, accesorios, útiles escolares, encajes  y mercancía que viene en oferta en su catalogo. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado su crecimiento empresarial y personal y ella lo considera así. Su sueño mas adelante es tener su propia casa, con instalaciones adecuadas para su negocio desde antes de ubicarlo y esto daría mayor confort a sus clientela, a si misma y a su familia, por lo cual se convierte en su principal desafío.
texts.en:
Marly came to Barranquilla in the year 2000, from Sincelejo, the capital of Sucre, with many dreams and began working as a manager, got married and had 2 children, and today they are 6 and 9 years old, and this caused her to spend more time at home and so she left her employment and began to do activities that permitted her to earn money while at the same time caring for her family. She had the inclination for assembling crafts with hardware, making silver accessories, an activity that she learned in a workshop near her home, where she helped a neighbor that worked in silver.

Through some visual media she learned about the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and became interested in its training program for entrepreneurs and later she applied for loans with which she bought her rolling mill, with which she gradually became independent. Little by little she was thinking of diversifying her products. She bought four display cases, one motor toll, one drill press, welding equipment and also added various merchandise changing her business into a general store as she is functioning today. She is helped in her business by her sister, a friend, and her husband, who sells the items she makes. In her business she sells by credit and cash. Her customers come to her business to buy miscellaneous items and she has enough space in her house to display her work.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her seventh loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy miscellaneous items such as clothing, accessories, school supplies, lacework, and merchandise that she sells from her catalog. She had successful business and personal growth with her previous loans as she herself believes. Her dream going forward is to have her own house, with adequate facilities for her business before setting it up and thus giving the best comfort to her customers, herself and her family, therefore it becomes her main challenge.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items such as clothing, accessories, school supplies, lacework, and merchandise that she offers from her catalog

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Margaret has operated a grocery sales business, selling at retail and at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Margaret plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of bananas, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Remeo, a signboard vendor, and is the mother of four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Virgina works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a business making signboards, mainly offering signboards used in jeepneys and buses. She buys her materials and supplies for signboard making and manufactures different types. Her regular customers are utility vehicle owners and drivers. Virgina earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Virginia is requesting a PHP 34,000 loan, which she will use to buy supplies and materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Virginia hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de ropa nueva y pollos de engorde, con esta inversión espera aumentar la mercadería de prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, tambien iniciar con una  granja que aumentara con la nueva inclusión de pollos. 
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, generándole el negocio más ganancias, esto la motiva a continuar trabajando para poder ir superándose con su familia.
texts.en:
María has decided to take out a new loan to buy new clothes and chickens to raise. With this investment, she hopes to increase her clothing merchandise to sell, such as blouses, skirts and underwear. She also wants to start a farm that will include chickens. 
 
The previous loan had a positive effect, generating more income for her business. This motivates her to continue working to be able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, underwear and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en: Lourgen is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Lourgen has operated a motorcycle rental business for 6 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 7,000 from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,700 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2004, Lourgen joined GDMPC. She hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, Beatrice has operated a paraffin sales business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to supply a larger market in the future. Beatrice plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 52, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent with four children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. Alicia works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a piggery, selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Alicia also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Alicia earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Alicia is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Alicia hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, quiere surtir el negocio de productos para la canasta básica, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le ayude a invertir en gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, embutidos, huevos, condimentos, para estar preparada para atender la demanda, que espera que en la vacaciones aumente la afluencia de clientes.
Ella a través del préstamo anterior, logro mejorar el negocio, obteniendo más ingresos para mejorar su situación económica, cancelo la deuda y ha cubierto sus gastos familiares,  con el negocio se mantiene aportando para el bienestar de la familia y está satisfecha por lo que ha logrado.
texts.en:
Ana wants to stock her business with basic family basket products. For this, she is asking for a loan to help her invest in soft drinks, juices, snacks, cold cuts, eggs, and condiments to be ready to meet the demand she hopes for during vacation with an influx of customers.  

With the previous loans, she was able to improve her business, obtaining more income to improve her financial situation. She paid off her debt and has covered her family expenses. With her business she keeps contributing to her family's wellbeing and she is satisfied with what she was able to do.

loans.use: to buy sof drinks, juices, snacks, cold cuts, eggs, and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more snakeskin fruit to sell

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is 41 years old. She lives in a small village in the Sighnaghi District with her family: her husband, Zaza, and her 19-year-old son. The family earns its living through an agricultural business. They have a plot of land, where they grow cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers and maize. All family members are actively involved in the spring seasonal work on their plot. Nargiza sells the harvested products in the village to green grocery retailers. The family also owns a greenhouse, where they grow cucumber saplings. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL. 

Nargiza has requested a loan to rent a tractor to till the land and to purchase fertilizers and maize for sowing. After the seasonal work is properly done, Nargiza hopes that the weather conditions will be favorable and the family will get a good harvest, which will be sold for a convenient price. The family will then get its planned profit, which will be used to finance its daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to rent a tractor to till the land

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Judith has operated a business selling beer and soda for 10 years, working 7 days a week. She sells her products in a shop, at both wholesale and retail prices.

Judith has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. The main business challenges for Judith include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to build her own house. Judith lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food for the family, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 26 years old, runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people have the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Francis has been able to improve his business, which he hopes to expand in the future. Francis has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Nuri Rajawali Group

texts.en:
Ida is a mother of three children who has been selling bottled tea and pop ice since 2009. She is pictured in the middle. She opened a small kiosk in front of her house. Her business is running smoothly, most of her customer like to buy bottled tea and children like to buy pop ice. Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more bottled tea and pop ice to have more supplies in her kiosk. From her business, she can supplement her husband's income as a driver of a motorcycle (called ojeg in Indonesia) to provide for school fees and daily basic needs for her family. In the future, she wants to expand her business and enlarge her store.

Other group members plan to use their part of the loan to improve their businesses selling clothes on credit and selling stationary.

loans.use: to pay for more tea bottles and pop ice to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas por mayor, es socia de Finca Perú hace 16 años, ella ve todo lo que ha crecido y da gracias a Finca Perú por todo lo que le ayudo con los préstamos.Para ella los préstamos son muy buenos porque Finca Perú le da esa confianza que otras entidades no le dan, está muy agradecida porque gracias a ello  puede progresar junto a sus hijos y crecer como empresaria. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de papa.
texts.en: Antonia is a member of the communal bank "Suni."  She is 52 years old, and has 2 children.  She has a business selling groceries and beverages at wholesale.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 16 years, and she sees all of the growth that has occurred.  She thanks FINCA Peru for all of the help they have given her with the loans.  For Antonia, the loans are great because FINCA Peru puts trust in her that other establishments won't.  She is very grateful because thanks to this, she can get ahead with her children and grow as a businesswoman.  The loan she is taking now will be used to buy potatoes.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for her business

loans.name: Griselda De La Paz

texts.es:
Griselda, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de un pedido para la tienda, en el cual incluye: aceite, harina, pastas, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, pues son de consumo de primera necesidad, estos son demandados por sus clientes.
Ella dice que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener una mejor solvencia económica, atender la demanda, seguir en crecimiento con el negocio, para poderle ofrecer lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Griselda is requesting a new loan to buy an order of products for her store, which will include: cooking oil, flour, pasta, sugar, soap, and detergents.  These are consumer staples that her customers demand.

She says that her previous loan helped her to have better financial situation, meet her customer's demands, and continue to grow her business so that she could provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, pasta, sugar, soap, and detergent

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is a widow who has an only child. She is 67 years old and lives in Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Visitacion owns and operates a plot of farmland, where she plants banana to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 11,700 to purchase farm chemicals. Visitacion became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2010. Visitacion hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef is 34 years old. He lives in the village of Sighnaghi District, a tourist area in East Georgia. Josef lives with his wife, Madona, and father. The family has 1.5 hectares of land where pepper and watermelon are grown. Josef and Madona sell harvested products locally to the greengrocery products retailers. Along with the above-mentioned, a bread bakery owned by the family is a source of their income. It is managed by Josef. He bakes traditional Georgian bread and sells his production in the village. He sells on average 60 breads per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Josef requested a loan for purchasing flour and wood for the bakery and to pay for tilling the family's land. He will use the flour and wood for baking more bread, which will be sold to local retailers. As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the family will get more income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour and wood for his bakery

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to boost her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase an overlocking machine (a serger). The previous loan had a lot of impact on her business since she was able to purchase two sewing machines and put up her family house. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop selling cloth materials. Her family's standard of living has improved and they are now living in their own house.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock (serger) machine.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a business frying potatoes and making dumplings, which she sells from home. Umazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She wants to build a shade for her business with a 20000 KES loan.

loans.use: to build a shade for her business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 48 años de edad, es dueña de un restaurante, es madre de 2 hijos,gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió en su Bancomunal aprendió la responsabilidad, los valores y a no mentir, ella dice que la forma de trabajar de Finca Perú es muy buena porque le ayuda a estar bien preparada para cualquier dificultad, puede educar a sus hijos y eso le llena de mucha satisfacción. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una cocina y útiles de cocina.
texts.en: Celina is a member of the communal bank Suni. She is 48 years old and is the owner of a restaurant. She is the mother of two children. Thanks to the training that she received in her communal bank, she learned responsibility, values, and to be honest. She says that the way Finca Peru works is very good because it helps her to be well prepared for any difficulty. She can educate her children, and this fills her with great satisfaction. The present loan is destined for the purchase of a stove and kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to buy a stove and kitchen utensils for her business.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 49 años de edad, es dueña de una panadería, ella misma prepara el pan, también vende comida y jugos, siempre se dedico a trabajar duro para poder progresar junto a sus 8 hijos. Es socia de Finca hace 4 años y pudo aprender muchas cosas que le ayudaron a valorarse y aprender a seguir progresando a pesar de las dificultades. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de harina y azúcar.
texts.en: Luzmila is a member of the communal bank Suni. She is 49 years old and is the owner of a bakery. She herself prepares the bread. She also sells food and juices. She always works hard in order to be able to move forward together with her 8 children. She has been a member of Finca for 8 years, and she was able to learn many things which helped her to value herself and to learn to continue making progress in spite of the difficulties. Now her loan will be used to buy flour and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar for her business

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kolaban, composées de mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de gâteaux et de condiments.                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Kolaban sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente BINTOU, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debouts, compte acheter 10 kilos de sel, quelques boites de purée de tomate et des épices sèche avec les revendeurs de Nangola pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 6 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women from Kolaban group, consisting of married and widowed women, are on average 38 years old with 3 children and all live with large traditional families in the village of N'Tjifina, subprefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell tubers, cakes and condiments. The women from Kolaban group are on their third group loan. The client Bintou, the first person from the left in the line of standing people, plans to buy 10 kg of salt, a few boxes of tomato paste and dried spices from the resellers of Nangola and then sell them in the village to a clientèle consisting of women and men. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 6,000 FCFA which will be used for the family's needs and partly reinvested in the business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 46 años de edad, no tiene hijos, vive con su mamá y su sobrina que se encuentra a su cargo, ella siempre trabajó para progresar junto a su mamá y su sobrina, ella se dedica  a la siembra y venta de vegetales, es dueña de una chacra, es socia de Finca Perú hace 7 años y está muy agradecida porque le ayudó a que su sobrina sea profesional, ella dice que cuando su papá tuvo Cáncer recibió mucha ayuda de Finca Perú y eso lo valora mucho, porque sabe que cuando más lo necesite la ayudarán. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the communal bank Suni. She is 46 years old. She has no children. She lives with her mother and her niece, for whom she is responsible. She always worked to make progress together with her mother and her niece. She plants and sells vegetables. She is the owner of a farm. She has been a member of Finca Peru for 7 years, and she is very thankful because it helped her niece  to have a career. She says that when her father had cancer, she received a lot of help from Finca Peru, and she values this a lot, because she knows that when she needs it most they will help her. Her present loan is destined for the purchase of fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia lives at Dalaoig with her two children. She carries the burden alone in providing for her children. To generate an income, she operates a small store selling grocery items to the people in her village. From this, she is able to acquire P200 a day by selling her products. It goes for meals and daily allowances in school. She is now borrowing a loan of P10,000 to increase the range of merchandise she offers. She will buy canned goods, eggs, noodles and detergent to sell in her store. Someday, she hopes to establish a more convenient store to display her products and keep generating income for her little family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, noodles and detergent to sell in her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a responsible and energetic mother. She is married to a farmer while she runs a small retail store. They both generate an income to meet their family's daily consumption in food and school allowances for their child. Helen had been running her store for about 10 years now. She is happy for the business she has though she only acquires P200 each day selling these products. 

She aspires for businesss expansion so she is now borrowing a loan of P10,000 to buy sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, bread and eggs to sell. She will be very happy if this loan is given to her and promises to pay it back in full. 

Helen is also praying for good health and good relationships towards her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, canned goods, bread and eggs to sell
